citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Multiple live rats were seen moving freely in and out of the enclosure housing one squirrel monkey. The facility said that
they recently started a new bait program; however, it is currently not effective at controlling rodents at the facility.
Pests such as rats can spread disease and contaminate food, surfaces, and animal housing areas. An effective program
for control of insects, external parasites affecting nonhuman primates, and birds and mammals that are pests, must be
established and maintained so as to promote the health and well-being of the animals and reduce contamination by pests
in animal areas.
To be corrected by February 12, 2025.

Multiple live rats were seen inside the enclosure housing four ferrets. While the inspector observed, at least five rats were
seen moving freely in and out of the enclosure and eating the food left out for the ferrets. The facility said that they
recently started a new bait program; however, it is currently not effective at controlling rodents at the facility.
Pests such as rats can spread disease and contaminate food, surfaces, and animal housing areas. A safe and effective
program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be established and maintained.
To be corrected by February 12, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.84(d) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Multiple live rats were seen moving freely in and out of the enclosure housing one squirrel monkey. The facility said that 
they recently started a new bait program; however, it is currently not effective at controlling rodents at the facility. 
Pests such as rats can spread disease and contaminate food, surfaces, and animal housing areas. An effective program 
for control of insects, external parasites affecting nonhuman primates, and birds and mammals that are pests, must be 
established and maintained so as to promote the health and well-being of the animals and reduce contamination by pests 
in animal areas.  
To be corrected by February 12, 2025. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
Multiple live rats were seen inside the enclosure housing four ferrets. While the inspector observed, at least five rats were 
seen moving freely in and out of the enclosure and eating the food left out for the ferrets. The facility said that they 
recently started a new bait program; however, it is currently not effective at controlling rodents at the facility. 
Pests such as rats can spread disease and contaminate food, surfaces, and animal housing areas. A safe and effective 
program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be established and maintained. 
To be corrected by February 12, 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
